newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Asian dollar deposits quietly steady in late trade.
newsitem.headline: Asian dollar deposits quietly steady in late trade.

text.p: Asian dollar deposit rates were quietly steady in lacklustre trade, dealers said on Friday.

Most traders were sidelined ahead of tonight's release of the U.S. fourth quarter gross domestic product (GDP), January existing homes, February Chicago purchasing managers index (PMI), and February University of Michigan consumer sentiment index (CSI) data.
The fourth quarter GDP is forecast to show a gain of 4.1 percent compared with a 4.7 percent increase reported in the previous quarter.
"But I don't think there will be much impact here unless the numbers are way off market expectations. Also, most people have squared their positions for the weekend," he said.
In day-to-day rates, weekend eased 1/8 percentage point to 5-5/16 5-3/16 percent but Monday/Tuesday and week-fixed were unchanged from Thursday's common 5-7/16 5-5/16 percent, respectively.
Among longer dates, one-month was unchanged from Thursday's 5-7/16 5-5/16 percent and three-months unchanged at 5-9/16 5-7/16.
Nine-months eased 3/8 point to 5-3/8 5-1/4 percent and twelve-months eased 7/16 point to 5-7/16 5-5/16 percent.
